p: The N protein functions primarily by binding the viral genome and organizing it as a nucleocapsid. Putatively, it can also contribute to the virion formation. The M protein defines the shape of the envelope, promotes the final viral assembly, and together with the E protein forms the envelope. The E protein is the smallest viral protein inside the infected cells, but only a small portion is incorporated into the virion envelope. The S protein mediates the attachment of the virus to the host cell membrane receptor ( Xia et al., 2020). Because of its role in starting the viral infection, the S proteins are particularly of interest since they also determine the efficiency of the infection and its spreading ( Zhou et al., 2020).
